Read current information about course reserves.

Reserve requests are processed in the order in which they are received. Please allow 14 days to process requests. If the library needs to recall or purchase the material, requests may take longer to fill. Although we make every effort to process requests quickly, we cannot guarantee timely service for last-minute requests. You will receive an e-mail confirmation when your reserve request has been received. Reserve requests are made by selecting items from Virgo.

Request Items for Course Reserves Using Virgo

  1. Search for the materials you would like to place on reserve for your course.
  2. Bookmark the items needed for reserve. The bookmark option appears in the search results view, as well as on the dedicated item page. 
    • You will be prompted to sign in to Virgo when you click the bookmark icon, unless you’ve already authenticated.
       

    •  

  3. In the resulting window, you can create a new folder for the item(s), use the “General” folder, or use another folder you’ve previously created.     
    • We recommend using the Course ID or a meaningful folder name like “Video Reserves”. 

       

  4. Continue searching and bookmarking until all desired items are in the folder.  Folders and their contents are persistent in your account, so they can be re-used and supplemented as needed.
  5. When you’re finished adding items, click “Signed in as [UVA ID]” in the site header, and select “Bookmarks” from the drop-down menu.

    •  

  6. Click the name of the folder where you saved your items for Reserve. 
  7. Click check boxes next to the items you want to place on reserve. 
  8. When complete, click on the “Place on Course Reserve” button. 

     

  9. Fill out the resulting form, which requires the course ID, academic term, your preferred reserve location, and loan period to complete your request.
    • Important, for video reserves: Select Clemons as your preferred reserve location.Fill out the Preferred Audio Language, Subtitles, Subtitle Language, and Notes  fields. 

    •  

  10. Click “Submit Request” 
  11. Important! For video reserves, there is one final step: You will need to provide access to your Collab site.
    • On your course’s Collab site, go to Site Info.
    • Click on Add Participant at the top.
    • On the next page, type vid-lib into the top box. Click Continue.
    • On the next page, select Secondary Instructor. Click Continue.
    • On the next page, click Continue.
    • On the last page, click Finish.
